moves.2. b3: White advances a pawn to b3 on the queen side to open up his bishop.
moves.2... Nf6: I bring out my kings knight to f6 to pressure the middle white pawn on e4.
moves.3. Nc3: White brings out the queens knight to c3 to protect the middle e4 pawn.
moves.3... d5: I bring up my black pawn to d5 to add pressure to the middle pawn in e4.
moves.4. e5: White passes my black pawn and puts pressure on black knight on f6.
moves.4... Ne4: I move up my knight to e4.
moves.5. Nxd5: White knight takes my pawn in d5.
moves.5... Qxd5: I take the knight in d5 with my queen. That was a blunder I guess. I was not sure if it was a trap of some kind. Time will tell.
moves.6. Bc4: White brings out the bishop to c4 and pressures my queen in d5.
moves.6... Qd4: I push up my black queen to d4 pressuring the rook in a1 and same time his King and pawn on f2 which has pressure from my knight.
moves.7. Qe2: White queen  protects her King by moving to e2.
moves.7... Qxa1: I take the rook in a1 with my queen. I now have pressure on his bishop on c1.
moves.8. Qd1: White brings back the queen to d1 to protect the bishop in c1.
moves.8... Qd4: I bring my black queen back to center on d4 to where he first countered with his queen to e2. This time I think he decides to do something different. Watch what happens next.
moves.9. Nf3: White brings out the kings side knight to f3 a strong position to pressure my queen on d4. His next move would be to castle O-O.
moves.9... Qxf2#: I had to move my queen out of harms way and I looked  at the pawn on f2 and see that its protected by my knight on e4. If I used my knight to take his pawn in f2 I would pressure his kings rook and queen at the same time. I had a better move and put him in checkmate with my queen to his pawn in f2 for check mate. This was my 5th win. This was done in 9 moves over a 12 day time period.
